conclusion: Initial shadows A, B, and C are cast to the right and slightly behind their objects.
Light source is located to the left and above the objects.
Light source moves to the right above the objects.
Shadows will shift horizontally towards the left as the light source moves to the right.
Shadow size depends on object size, distance between light source and object, distance between object and surface, and angle of light rays.
Shadows will become shorter as the light source moves horizontally closer to the objects.
Changes in position and size apply to shadows A, B, and C.
Initial light source location is implied by the shadow direction.
Shadows move in the opposite direction of the light source's horizontal movement.
Shadows become shorter as the light source moves horizontally closer to the object's position relative to the ground plane.
Final position change: Shadows A, B, and C move horizontally to the left.
Final size change: Shadows A, B, and C become shorter.
